snippet: The pension board of the United Methodist Church has decided to divest its shares in a British company that supplies security equipment to Israel.
abstract: United Methodist Church, America's largest mainline Protestant denomination, has decided to divest its shares in British company G4s, which supplies security equipment to Israel for use in prisons and in the occupied West Bank; move comes as Israel has been trying to fend off resolutions by variety of groups to divest from companies that do business with Israel.
lead_paragraph: The pension board of the United Methodist Church has decided to divest its shares in a British company that supplies security equipment to Israel.

headline.main: Methodists to Sell Shares as a Protest Over Israel
headline.print_headline: Methodists to Sell Shares as a Protest Over Israel
